ISSUE.TITLE: mmap in podman container returns ENODEV on MacOS Host
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION:
### Issue Description I'm trying to use cache files in a podman container. The cache files are shared across multiple `podman run` command. I used `mmap` to map the cache file into memory. That works fine on Linux host, but fails on MacOS host, with `ENODEV` error. ### Steps to reproduce the issue Consider the following Dockerfile and script. This script is supposed to compile and run a simple C program that uses mmap to map a file into memory. The file is mounted into the container using a volume mount. 1. Create a directory and put the Dockerfile and script in it. `Dockerfile` ```dockerfile FROM fedora:latest RUN dnf -y install gcc \ && dnf clean all ``` `run.sh` ```bash #!/bin/bash set -xeu podman build -t test . MOUNT_DIR=$(pwd)/mountdir mkdir -p ${MOUNT_DIR} cat <<EOF > ${MOUNT_DIR}/test.c #include <stdio.h> #include <stdlib.h> #include <unistd.h> #include <sys/mman.h> int main(int argc, char *argv[]) { if (argc != 2) { fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s <file>
", argv[0]); exit(EXIT_FAILURE); } const char* input_file = argv[1]; int result = 0; int fd; size_t size; void *addr; FILE* fp = fopen(input_file, "r"); if (fp == NULL) { perror("fopen"); result = EXIT_FAILURE; goto cleanup; } fd = fileno(fp); if (fd == -1) { perror("fileno"); result = EXIT_FAILURE; goto cleanup; } if (fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_END) == -1) { perror("fseek"); result = EXIT_FAILURE; goto cleanup; } size = ftell(fp); if (size == -1) { perror("ftell"); result = EXIT_FAILURE; goto cleanup; } addr = mmap(NULL, size, PROT_READ, MAP_SHARED, fd, 0); if (addr == MAP_FAILED) { perror("mmap"); result = EXIT_FAILURE; goto cleanup; } printf("size: %zu
", size); printf("addr: %p
", addr); if (munmap(addr, size) == -1) { perror("munmap"); result = EXIT_FAILURE; } else { result = EXIT_SUCCESS; } cleanup: if (fp != NULL) { fclose(fp); } return result; } EOF podman run --rm -v ${MOUNT_DIR}:/mnt test bash -c "gcc -o /mnt/a.out /mnt/test.c && /mnt/a.out /mnt/test.c" ``` 2. Run the `run.sh` script ### Describe the results you received The script works fine on Linux, but fails on MacOS with the following error: ``` mmap: No such device ``` which means `ENODEV`. ### Describe the results you expected Returns a valid address and size. For example, on Linux, the output is: ``` size: 1313 addr: 0x7f8a3333c000 ``` ### podman info output ```yaml $ podman version Client: Podman Engine Version: 4.6.1 API Version: 4.6.1 Go Version: go1.20.7 Git Commit: f3069b3ff48e30373c33b3f5976f15abf8cfee20 Built: Fri Aug 11 03:13:43 2023 OS/Arch: darwin/arm64 Server: Podman Engine Version: 4.6.0 API Version: 4.6.0 Go Version: go1.20.6 Built: Fri Jul 21 21:22:41 2023 OS/Arch: linux/arm64 $ podman info host: arch: arm64 buildahVersion: 1.31.0 cgroupControllers: - cpuset - cpu - io - memory - pids - rdma - misc cgroupManager: systemd cgroupVersion: v2 conmon: package: conmon-2.1.7-2.fc38.aarch64 path: /usr/bin/conmon version: 'conmon version 2.1.7, commit: ' cpuUtilization: idlePercent: 96.64 systemPercent: 2.94 userPercent: 0.42 cpus: 10 databaseBackend: boltdb distribution: distribution: fedora variant: coreos version: "38" eventLogger: journald freeLocks: 2048 hostname: localhost.localdomain idMappings: gidmap: null uidmap: null kernel: 6.4.7-200.fc38.aarch64 linkmode: dynamic logDriver: journald memFree: 7827574784 memTotal: 8299237376 networkBackend: netavark networkBackendInfo: backend: netavark dns: package: aardvark-dns-1.7.0-1.fc38.aarch64 path: /usr/libexec/podman/aardvark-dns version: aardvark-dns 1.7.0 package: netavark-1.7.0-1.fc38.aarch64 path: /usr/libexec/podman/netavark version: netavark 1.7.0 ociRuntime: name: crun package: crun-1.8.6-1.fc38.aarch64 path: /usr/bin/crun version: |- crun version 1.8.6 commit: 73f759f4a39769f60990e7d225f561b4f4f06bcf rundir: /run/crun spec: 1.0.0 +SYSTEMD +SELINUX +APPARMOR +CAP +SECCOMP +EBPF +CRIU +LIBKRUN +WASM:wasmedge +YAJL os: linux pasta: executable: /usr/bin/pasta package: passt-0^20230625.g32660ce-1.fc38.aarch64 version: | pasta 0^20230625.g32660ce-1.fc38.aarch64 Copyright Red Hat GNU Affero GPL version 3 or later <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/agpl-3.0.html> This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.
